snippet: An intense debate has erupted over when Tehran’s nuclear facilities will become invulnerable to an Israeli attack, and if economic sanctions need more time to work.
abstract: Israel and the United States are locked in an intense debate over when Iran's nuclear facilities will become invulnerable to an Israeli attack, and whether economic sanctions need more time to work; Israel says point of invulnerability is fast approaching, while US argues Israel and the West have more time and should allow sanctions and covert actions to deter Iran's plans.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and DAVID E. SANGER

lead_paragraph: An intense debate has erupted over when Tehran’s nuclear facilities will become invulnerable to an Israeli attack, and if economic sanctions need more time to work.

headline.seo: U.S. and Israel Split Over How to Deter Iran
headline.main: U.S. and Israel Split on Speed of Iran Threat
headline.print_headline: U.S. and Israel Split on Speed Of Iran Threat
